N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 21 ยง 5904.10 - Review of applications for planning and program development grant awards

State Regulations
(a) In reviewing
any application for planning and program development grant awards, the board
shall consider whether the applicant has satisfactorily demonstrated that, after completion of the planning and program development proposal submitted in
its application, it reasonably may be expected to be designated as a Center for

Advanced Technology pursuant to the provisions of this Part. In making its
determination, the board shall consider, among other things, whether the
applicant has satisfactorily demonstrated: (1)
an established record of research, development and instruction in the area or
areas of technology involved in its application; (2)
its capacity to conduct research and
development activities in collaboration with business and industry; (3)
its capacity to secure substantial
private and other governmental funding that would be necessary for the creation
and operation of a Center for Advanced Technology; (4)
its ability and willingness to cooperate
with other institutions in New York State in conducting research and
development activities and in disseminating research results, and to work with
technical and community colleges in the State to enhance the quality of
technical education in the area or areas of technology involved; (5)
its ability and willingness to cooperate
with the foundation and other economic development agencies in promoting the
growth and development in New York State of industries based upon or benefiting
from the area or areas of technology involved; (6)
its capacity or potential capacity to
implement an approved plan and program for the establishment and operation of a

Center for Advanced Technology; and
(7)
such other matters as the foundation may
require. (b) In
conducting its review of applications for planning and program development
grant awards, the board may use a committee of its members designated by the
chairman of the board to make recommendations to the board on such applications
and shall seek and consider the advice of peer review panels (as defined in
section
5904.2
[g]
of this

Part). (c) No application for a
planning and program development grant award shall be deemed approved until it
is approved by the board, and in no event shall any applicant be eligible to
receive more than one such grant award. Notes
